page.title: 01RATHO INTRODUCTION
page.content: THE VILLAGE OF{RATHO}LIES ABOUT TEN MILES WEST OF THE CITY OF{EDINBURGH} AND IS SET AMID GENTLY ROLLING COUNTRYSIDE. THE VILLAGE IS MAINLY A MAIN STREET WITH HOUSES ON EITHER SIDE. IN THE PAST TWENTY YEARS NEW PRIVATE HOUSING SCHEMES HAVE BEEN BUILT AT EITHER END OF THE VILLAGE. THE VILLAGE IS SURROUNDED BY FERTILE AGRICULTURAL LAND AND THE SIX OR SO FARMS PRODUCE WHEAT CROPS, MAINLY BARLEY. ONE OF THE MAIN FEATURES OF THE AREA IS THE{UNION CANAL}WHICH RUNS EAST TO WEST THROUGH WOODED COUNTRYSIDE. SEVERAL BARGES BASED AT RATHO USE THE CANAL FOR PLEASURE PURPOSES. ANOTHER FEATURE OF THE AREA ARE THE{QUARRIES.}THERE ARE SEVERAL DISUSED QUARRIES AS WELL AS TWO WORKING ONES WHICH PRODUCE LARGE QUANTITIES OF STONE FOR ROAD MAKING.
